solution.text:
Decrease or Increase= Difference in old price and new price.
Since New price < Old price, Decrease = Old price - New price.
Decrease = 4000- 3600 = Rs.400
Decrease percentage = (Decrease/Old Price) x 100
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, decrease percentage = (400/4000) x 100 = 10%

content.text: Price of a car went from Rs. 4000 this year to Rs. 3600 the next year.
